noun.description: A thing given as a reward to the winner of a competition or in recognition of an outstanding achievement.
examples: Britain's most prestigious prize for contemporary art

noun.description: An enemy ship captured during the course of naval warfare.
examples: the sloop had been taken as a prize

adjective.description: Having been or likely to be awarded a prize in a competition.

examples: the berries were prized for their healing properties

origin: Middle English: the noun, a variant of price; the verb (originally in the sense estimate the value of) from Old French pris-, stem of preisier to praise, appraise (see praise).
